description: Hike to Half Dome
Rafting in the Colorado River
Watch the Old Faithful Geyser
Trek the W Circuit and see jagged peaks, glaciers, and unreal landscapes.
Summit North America's tallest peak—if I ever get good enough at mountaineering.
Hike to one of the most surreal rock formations in the world—if I win the permit lottery.
Walk across the fjords where mountains drop straight into white sand beaches.
Backpack 93 miles around Mount Rainier, through glaciers, meadows, and suffering.
Walk across the world's largest salt flat, where the sky and ground become one.
Camp in complete isolation and see caribou migrations in one of the wildest places left on Earth.
Backpack into the Grand Canyon and swim in unreal turquoise waterfalls.
Thru-hike 211 miles of Sierra Nevada wilderness, from Yosemite to Mount Whitney.
Wild camp in the middle of nowhere, surrounded by misty mountains and lochs.
Climb the famous cables route and take in the view from one of the most iconic summits in the U.S.
Explore lava fields, glaciers, waterfalls, and maybe even see an active eruption.
Summit Wyoming’s tallest mountain, deep in the rugged Wind River Range.
Paddle through the floodplains, surrounded by elephants, hippos, and total wilderness.
Hike through alpine lakes, glaciers, and take the cliché Moraine Lake photo.
Backpack one of the last truly wild coastlines in the U.S., where the Pacific meets the mountains.
Kayak through glowing water that lights up when you move.
Camp with no tent, no sleeping bag—just me, the ground, and an open sky.
Walk along boardwalks between turquoise lakes and cascading waterfalls.
Walk through the narrow sandstone canyon when the light beams hit just right.
